channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: Hybristophilia: Study links TikTok to women’s sexual attraction to criminals
item.description: Ted Bundy had courtroom groupies. Jeffrey Dahmer and Richard Ramirez were sent love letters in prison. Now, in the age of social media, thousands like, share, and thirst in the comments over stylized fan edits of serial killers. There’s a term for this psychological phenomenon: hybristophilia.
item.dc:creator: Eve Upton-Clark, Fast Company

item.title: How Apple managed to deliver a strong third quarter despite a global trade war
item.description: Apple delivered financial results during its summertime quarter that exceeded analyst projections, despite being caught in the crosshairs of a global trade war at the same time the trendsetting company is scrambling to catch up to its Big Tech peers in the artificial intelligence race.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fast Company

item.title: New LinkedIn phishing scam targets executives with fake board positions
item.description: No, you're not being invited to invest in South American businesses, you're being scammed into handing over Microsoft login credentials.
item.dc:creator: Sead Fadilpašić, TechRadar

item.title: It was the hottest thing in climate tech. Now it’s trapped in the valley of death
item.description: A year ago, direct air capture—technology that pulls CO2 from the air—seemed ready to quickly scale in the U.S. Project Cypress, a massive undertaking in Louisiana designed to capture more than a million tons of CO2 each year, won $50 million in funding from the Department of Energy in early 2024.
item.dc:creator: Adele Peters, Fast Company

item.title: AMD has ended support for RX 6000 GPUs – here's why it's a massive blunder in the battle against Nvidia
item.description: In a baffling move, AMD ends support for relatively recent RX 6000 GPUs – and gamers are up in arms (myself included).
item.dc:creator: Darren Allan, TechRadar

item.title: Black vultures attack and kill cattle. Climate change is one reason they're spreading north
item.description: Black vultures have killed and eaten several calves on Tom Karr’s cattle ranch in southeastern Ohio, a loss he says didn't happen two decades ago.
item.dc:creator: Joshua A. Bickel And Melina Walling, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Breaking the humanoid robot delusion
item.description: A Silicon Valley company called 1X this week announced a humanoid robot that does all your housework. The robot is called NEO. The company says NEO is the world’s first consumer-ready humanoid robot for the home.
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: MacBook Pro M5 has an incredibly fast SSD that even Apple undersold with its marketing
item.description: Apple's new MacBook Pro isn't just about the M5 – it packs another surprisingly peppy upgrade under the hood.
item.dc:creator: Darren Allan, TechRadar

item.title: OpenAI’s Atlas ushers in the era of AI browsing. Here’s what it means for media
item.description: For the past 30 years, the web browser has been the primary way humans navigate the internet. It makes sense, then, that as artificial intelligence becomes more humanlike in its capabilities, it would use the same tool.
item.dc:creator: Pete Pachal, Fast Company

item.title: Universal Music and AI song tool Udio settle lawsuit and partner on new platform, sparking backlash
item.description: LONDON (AP) — Universal Music Group and AI song generation platform Udio have settled a copyright infringement lawsuit and agreed to team up on new music creation and streaming platform, the two companies said in a joint announcement.
item.dc:creator: KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Mistake-filled legal briefs show the limits of relying on AI tools at work
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Judges around the world are dealing with a growing problem: legal briefs that were generated with the help of artificial intelligence and submitted with errors such as citations to cases that don’t exist, according to attorneys and court documents.
item.dc:creator: CATHY BUSSEWITZ, Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: Trump, Xi didn't discuss Taiwan, Russian oil nor Blackwell chips
item.description: President Trump said the issues of Taiwan, Russian oil and Nvidia's advanced Blackwell chip weren't raised during his wide-ranging meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping in South Korea on Thursday. “Taiwan never came up.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, The Hill

item.title: How tiny drones inspired by bats could save lives in dark and stormy conditions
item.description: Researchers at Worcester Polytechnic Institute are developing tiny drones inspired by bats for search and rescue missions.
item.dc:creator: Holly Ramer, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Google's corporate parent posts first-ever quarter with $100B in revenue in latest show of its power
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Google’s corporate parent on Wednesday announced its first-ever quarter with more than $100 billion in revenue, a milestone that illustrates the unwavering power of its internet empire amid legal and competitive threats. The news of Alphabet Inc.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: A company that went from startup to program-of-the-year winner through AI innovation
item.description: "You always start with the people, having good members within your team that are always thinking ahead," Alexander Granados said. The post A company that went from startup to program-of-the-year winner through AI innovation first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gerton, Federal News Network

item.title: Phony AI-generated videos of Hurricane Melissa flood social media sites
item.description: One viral video shows what appears to be four sharks swimming in a Jamaican hotel's pool as floodwaters allegedly brought on by Hurricane Melissa swamp the area. Another purportedly depicts Jamaica's Kingston airport completely ravaged by the storm.
item.dc:creator: TAIMOOR SOBHAN and KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Nvidia moves to build AI-native 5G/6G wireless stack for future networks
item.description: Nvidia is working with a cadre of industry expert at Booz Allen, Cisco, MITRE, ODC, Nokia and T-Mobile to bring an AI-native wireless stack for 6G networking to fruition.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Apple Watch Series 11: The things you don’t see
item.description: While there were solid improvements in the last generation of Apple’s popular wearable, the huge 24-hour battery life in Apple Watch Series 11 means this smartwatch has finally become what it always promised to be: a device capable of running all day and all night, which is especially for tasks like
item.dc:creator: Computer World

item.title: Character.AI to ban children from talking with chatbots
item.description: Character.AI plans to ban children from talking with its AI chatbots starting next month amid growing scrutiny over how young users are interacting with the technology.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: Nvidia becomes world’s first $5 trillion company
item.description: Nvidia on Wednesday became the first company in the world to reach a $5 trillion valuation. The chipmaker’s stock jumped 3 percent at market open, pushing the company above the historic milestone.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: Cisco, Nvidia strengthen AI ties with new data center switch, reference architectures
item.description: Cisco and Nvidia are ramping up their partnership, and the latest deliverables include the new Cisco N9100 series data center switch built on Nvidia’s Spectrum-X Ethernet switch silicon.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: AI truck system matches top human drivers in massive safety showdown with perfect scores
item.description: Kodiak Driver autonomous truck achieves perfect 98 safety score, matching top human fleets in groundbreaking AI evaluation by Nauto's VERA system.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: The quiet glory of REST and JSON
item.description: I don’t expect that many developers today fully appreciate the quiet glory that is REST and JSON. But then, most developers today have not been around the software business as long as I have. It’s only natural that we old timers have a clearer idea of how incredibly far the technology has come.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: IBM expands professional services for Cisco firewalls
item.description: IBM Technology Lifecycle Services has added Cisco’s firewall technology to its enterprise menu, expanding the range of technical services TLS offers for virtual and physical firewalls. IBM TLS will service Cisco’s Secure Firewall platform which is a core part of its Hybrid Mesh Firewall system.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: EPA deepens work with water sector amid rising cyber concerns
item.description: The EPA’s work to identify vulnerabilities in the water sector will be a critical piece of its efforts as the risk management agency for water utilities. The post EPA deepens work with water sector amid rising cyber concerns first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Justin Doubleday, Federal News Network

item.title: Yet another way the government shutdown is making things tough for contractors
item.description: "Fortunately for federal employees, they do have a law on the books from 2019 that guarantees back pay. Contractors don't have that," said Stephanie Kostro. The post Yet another way the government shutdown is making things tough for contractors first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gerton, Federal News Network

item.title: IT shortcuts curb AI returns
item.description: Nearly all the companies I talk to today are using AI, but most fall short when it comes to getting real value from AI, aside from a select few. Cisco calls these AI standouts the “pacesetters.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Stragglers from Myanmar scam center raided by army cross into Thailand as buildings are blown up
item.description: BANGKOK (AP) — The number of people fleeing from Myanmar to Thailand after Myanmar’s military shut down a major online scam center has slowed to a trickle, a Thai regional army commander said Tuesday, after more than 1,500 had left in the past week.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: New military age demands new C2 comms
item.description: As purposely scattered forces replace massing, all units need access to rich and latency-free crucial situational data regardless of from where they operate. The post New military age demands new C2 comms first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Tom Temin, Federal News Network

item.title: How to deploy an AI agent that actually solves help desk tickets
item.description: Help desks need help. But many of the agents coming to the rescue are chatbots in disguise. They claim to “resolve tickets” or “transform IT support,” but when you actually roll them out, most of these tools end up routing tickets, not resolving them.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: AI security system mistakes student's bag of Doritos for weapon
item.description: A Maryland high schooler said police told him an AI detector had flagged the crumpled bag of chips in his pocket as a weapon.
item.dc:creator: Zach Kaplan, NewsNation

item.title: OPM bringing protections for data breach victims to an end
item.description: The Office of Personnel Management transferred the current identity protection contract to GSA in September and will let it run out at the end of 2026. The post OPM bringing protections for data breach victims to an end first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Jason Miller, Federal News Network

item.title: Tesla revives 'Mad Max' mode in Full Self-Driving
item.description: Tesla's FSD v14.1.2 update reintroduces Mad Max mode, enabling higher speeds and more frequent lane changes than the standard Hurry profile setting.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Beware fake credit card account restriction scams
item.description: A phishing email scam targeting American Express customers shows how cybercriminals use fake urgent messages to steal personal and financial information.
item.dc:creator: Fox News
